greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least common multiple of {2^k - 1, k=1..n}.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
J. B. Marshall, On the extension of Fermat's theorem to matrices of order n, Proceedings of the Edinburgh Mathematical Society 6 (1939) 85-91. See (10) page 90 for p=2.
MathOverflow, Do we know any bound on lcm(2^1-1, 2^2-1, ..., 2^n-1)?
formula: a(n) = Product_{k=1..n} Phi_k(2), where Phi_n(2) is n-th cyclotomic polynomial at x=2 (cf. A019320). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 20 2002
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n=1, 1, ilcm(a(n-1), 2^n-1)) end:
program: (MAGMA) [Lcm([2^k-1:k in [1..n]]): n in [1..17]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Jan 29 2020
results.author: _Jeffrey Shallit_, Apr 20 2000
